question: You have just been hired by a company new to Scrum. Your management has assigned you to be the Scrum Master of six new Scrum Teams. These teams will build one product. Select two conditions you should strive for in this scenario. (choose two)
Choices.0: There should be six Product Owners one for each Scrum Team.
Choices.1: There should be six Product Owners reporting to a chief Product Owner.
Choices.2: The product has one Product Backlog.
Choices.3: Each Scrum Team should have a separate Product Backlog.
rightchoice: There should be only one Product Owner.

question: A Scrum Team has been working on a product for nine Sprints. A new Product Owner comes in understanding he is accountable for the Product Backlog. However he is unsure about his responsibilities. Which two activities are part of the Product Owner role according to Scrum? (choose two)
Choices.0: Ensuring that the most valuable functionality is produced first at all times.
Choices.1: Interacting with stakeholders.
Choices.2: Providing the Development Team with detailed specifications.
Choices.3: Describing features as Use Cases.
rightchoice: Creating detailed functional test cases.

question: User documentation is part of your definition of Done". However there aren’t enough technical writers for all teams. Your Development Team doesn’t have a technical writer. What should you do?"
Choices.0: Form a separate team of technical writers that will work on an on-demand basis for the various Product Owners. Work order will be first in first out.
Choices.1: Let the user documentation remain undone and accumulate until after the last development Sprint. It will then be done by any available technical writers.
Choices.2: Wait until you have a technical writer on your Development Team to take care of this.
Choices.3: Your Development Team is still responsible for creating user documentation. In this case the Development Team members will write it.

question: You are the Scrum Master for four Scrum Teams working from the same Product Backlog. Several of the developers come to you complaining that work identified for the upcoming two Sprints will require full-time commitment from a technical specialist who is external to the teams. What are two key concerns for the Scrum Master to take into account in this situation? (choose two)
Choices.0: The desire to maintain a stable velocity.
Choices.1: The benefit of Development Teams figuring out a solution for themselves.
Choices.2: The need to have enough work to keep all Development Team members busy.
Choices.3: The ability of the Development Teams to produce integrated Increments.

question: The Product Backlog is ordered by:
Choices.0: The Product Owner with the most valuable items placed at the top.
Choices.1: Risk where safer items are at the top and riskier items are at the bottom.
Choices.2: Items are randomly arranged.
Choices.3: Size where small items are at the top and large items are at the bottom.

question: What happens if the Development Team cannot complete its work by the end of the Sprint?
Choices.0: The Sprint is extended and future Sprints use this new duration.
Choices.1: The Sprint length holds and the Development Team continuously learns what is actually possible to do within a Sprint of this length.
Choices.2: The Sprint is extended temporarily. Lessons are taken to ensure it doesn’t happen again.

question: Which topics should be discussed in the Sprint Review?
Choices.0: The Scrum process and how it was used during the Sprint.
Choices.1: Coding and engineering practices.
Choices.2: Sprint results.
Choices.3: All of the above.

question: A member of the Development Team takes the Scrum Master aside to express his concerns about data security issues. What should the Scrum Master do?
Choices.0: Add security to the definition of "Done".
Choices.1: Tell the Product Owner to stop further development of features until the issues are fixed.
Choices.2: Create a Product Backlog item for security.
Choices.3: Go check with the testers.
rightchoice: Ask the person to share the issue with the team as soon as possible.

question: What does it mean for a Development Team to be cross-functional?
Choices.0: The Development Team includes not only developers but also business analysts architects and testers.
Choices.1: The Development Team includes cross-skilled individuals who are able to contribute to do what is necessary to deliver an increment of software.
Choices.2: Developers on the Development Team work closely with business analysts architects developers and testers who are not on the team.
Choices.3: The Development Team is a virtual team drawing from separate teams of business analysts architects developers and testers.

question: Sprint burndown charts are an efficient tracking tool because they show:
Choices.0: An estimate of the total work remaining for the Sprint.
Choices.1: How much effort has gone into a Sprint.
Choices.2: How many hours have been worked by each Development Team member.
Choices.3: How many Product Backlog items remain.

question: How much work must a Development Team do to a Product Backlog item it selects for a Sprint?
Choices.0: A proportional amount of time on analysis design programming testing and documentation.
Choices.1: As much as it can fit into the Sprint. Any remaining work will be transferred to a subsequent Sprint.
Choices.2: All development work and at least some testing.
Choices.3: As much as it has told the Product Owner will be done for every Product Backlog item it selects in conformance with the definition of "Done".

question: Which statement best describes the Sprint Backlog as outcome of the Sprint Planning?
Choices.0: It is a complete list of all work to be done in a Sprint.
Choices.1: Every item has a designated owner.
Choices.2: Each task is estimated in hours.
Choices.3: It is the Development Team’s plan for the Sprint.
rightchoice: It is ordered by the Product Owner.

question: If burndown charts are used to visualize progress what does a trend line through a release burndown chart indicate? (choose the best answer)

Choices.1: When all work will be completed to the Scrum Team can be released for other work.
Choices.2: When the work remaining will likely be completed if nothing changes on the Product Backlog or the Development Team.
Choices.3: When the project will be over if the Product Owner removes work that is equal in effort to any new work that is added.

question: Who is responsible for engaging the stakeholders? (choose the best answer)
Choices.0: The Business Analyst.
Choices.1: The Development Team.
Choices.2: The Team Manager.
Choices.3: The Project Manager.
rightchoice: The Product Owner.

question: At the end of a Sprint Product Backlog item worked on during the Sprint does not meet the definition of Done". What two things should happen with the undone Product Backlog item? (choose the best two answers)"
Choices.0: If the stakeholders agree the Product Owner can accept it and release it to the users.
Choices.1: Put it on the Product Backlog for the Product Owner to decide what to do with it.
Choices.2: Review the item add the "Done" part of the estimate to the velocity and create a Story for the remaining work.
Choices.3: Do not include the item in the Increment this Sprint.

question: Which two of the following are true about the Scrum Master role? (choose the best two answers)

question: What are three benefits of self-organization? (choose the best three answers)

Choices.1: Increased rule compliance.
Choices.2: Increased accuracy of estimates.
Choices.3: Increased self-accountability

question: Which three of the following are time-boxed events in Scrum? (choose the best three answers)

Choices.1: Release Retrospective.

question: Who is responsible for clearly expressing Product Backlog items? (choose the best answer)

Choices.2: The Product Owner.

question: What is the best suited structure for Development Teams in order to produce integrated Increments? (choose the best answer)

question: Why should the Product Owner be present at the Daily Scrum? (choose the best answer)

question: What two techniques could the Scrum Master use when the Scrum Team gets caught in an internal disagreement about which development techniques to apply? (choose the best two answers)

question: When does the second Sprint start? (choose the best answer)

question: What is included in the Sprint Backlog? (choose the best answer)

question: Which of the following are true about the Product Owner role? (choose the best two answers)

question: True or False: When multiple teams work together on the same product each team should maintain a separate Product Backlog.

question: A Scrum Master is introducing Scrum to a new Development Team. The Development Team has decided that a Sprint Retrospective is unnecessary. What action should the Scrum Master take? (choose the best answer)

question: Which two things are appropriate for a Scrum Master to do if the Development Team doesn’t have the engineering tools and infrastructure to completely finish each selected Product Backlog item? (choose the best two answers)

rightchoice: Have the Development Team establish a Definition of "Done" that is actually possible to achieve given current circumstances.

question: When is implementation of a Product Backlog item considered complete? (choose the best answer)
